channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole by the telegraph pot., 16th June
item.description:
It's my garden at number 6. When the house was built about 10 years the edge was never finished or a curb put in.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bishops Close, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Footpaths on bith side of road uneven, jutting up paving slabs. Elderly resident now unable to walk from property due to regular trips/falls on roadside path. Daily observations of passing pedestrians also shows regular tripping on path., 16th June
item.description:
This is outside 42, but the issue is identical or worse for the majority of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Nettleton Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Alot of fly-tipping, 16th June
item.description:
The adopted road which looks like an alley way the runs down the back of Albert st+ Hungerford st in St Paul’s is a FLYTIPPING hotspot now the town centre tip has shut. Once people see this they add too it. I live on the corner of the alley way and am always clearing up stuff and personally taking stuff to the tip Myself . Please please can this be picked up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, St Paul's Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped black panel and mirror Brunswick St, 16th June
item.description:
A mirror and a black panel (stove top?) have been Flytipped on the pavement opposite 14 Brunswick St, next to Lidl. The mirror has already been broken a bit. Please can they be removed before they get smashed any more

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brunswick Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Large overgrown vegetation/weeds blocking footpath, 16th June
item.description:
I have copied and pasted the following email that was sent to me reporting this problem - Please can someone contact the contractor responsible for maintaining the walkway between Boverton Drive and Boverton Avenue. It is extremely overgrown with weeds and undergrowth making it very difficult to access. This morning followed a blind gentleman trying to navigate his way through with great difficulty.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 63, Boverton Avenue, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Brookway Drive, Cheltenham

item.description:
Customer reports that the fencing opposite Warren Close is overgrown and they are worried this is result in the pipe under the road being blocked, and flooding when it rains.

item.title: Abandoned car for weeks, 15th June
item.description:
Outside 2 Jersey Avenue for 4 weeks missing wing mirror not moved once. I’m trying to get gully fixed but can’t find owner asked on various sites with no response. Looks like it’s been abandoned. Gully request info Web Reference: 7712799 Enquiry Number: 22080433 Smells like sewerage plant outside no 2 & no 4 Jersey Avenue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Kings Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole or surface erosion area where the top layer of asphalt has worn away, 15th June
item.description:
A pothole or surface erosion area where the top layer of asphalt has worn away, exposing loose gravel and small stones underneath. Loose gravel and broken asphalt pieces are visible. The pothole is relatively shallow but could worsen over time with traffic and weather.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Ansell Close, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
